Key Match Events: Klay Thompson ended his half with 11 points in 16 minutes as the Mavericks led 64-61.
Luka Doncic and Quentin Grimes were in double figures, and Dallas fielded a new-look lineup with Maxi Kleber and Grimes in the starting five.
Pre-Game Insights: The four-time NBA champion was off the blocks slowly in the first quarter.
Thompson's scoring and his pesky defense have already made the difference despite the Mavericks 5-7 run so far.
Injuries and inconsistency have played their part in the losses, but Thompson has cemented himself as the third scorer behind Doncic and Irving.
Post-Match Reflections: Klay Thompson's 17 points weren't enough as the Utah Jazz edged past the Dallas Mavericks 115-113 to secure their first win at home.
Thompson has looked effective for Mavericks in his maiden stint.
With more chemistry and continuity, expect the 14.5 points per game to see a sharp rise as the Mavs look to shed their early season struggles.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Trending: Player stats for Klay Thompson including points, rebounds, assists, steals, blocks, turnovers, field goals, three-pointers, and free throws.
Klay Thompson comes into the Jazz matchup averaging 14.5 points, 3.7 rebounds, 2.1 assists, 0.5 steals, and 0.2 blocks from 11 games.
He's shooting 41.7% from the field and 37.2% from beyond the arc.
The Dallas Mavericks inked Klay Thompson to a three-year deal with faith in his championship DNA and versatile two-way play.
